_header: Though philosophers of good knowledge did obtain
Subjects: Arthur, prince of Wales; Catharine of Aragon; occasional verse; pageant verses
_description: ‘The speech of Raphaell’ at the pageant celebrating the marriage of Prince Arthur to Princess Catharine — five stanzas rhyme royal

BLCottVitAXVI.First Lines: Though Philyzophers of god knolege did opteynBy the meane of Creatures yit be ye sure…
BLCottVitAXVI.Last Lines: …And ye shall shortly of your Spouse ArthureSe a more persight & expresse fygure
BLCottVitAXVI.Attributed Title: The spech of Raphaell within the volvell (f. 188)
